isis.stitle: ALTERNATOR: DELCO-REMY 21-SI SERIES - TROUBLESHOOTING - CHARGING SYSTEM

svcprocinfo.para: Check electrical system wiring and battery terminals for poor connections or other obvious conditions that might result in shorts, opens, grounds, or high resistance. Correct as necessary.
Check alternator drive belt for proper tension. Adjust to specifications.

Check battery for state-of-charge. If low, recharge according to manufacturer's specifications and load test to establish serviceability. Refer to GROUP 08-MAINTENANCE FREE BATTERY. Further diagnostic tests require a known good, fully-charged battery for best results.
With engine stopped and all electrical loads turned off, use voltmeter to check voltage across battery terminals. Record voltage.
Start engine and run at moderate speed. Check voltage across battery terminals with engine running.
If voltage reading at battery terminals is different from reading showing at vehicle voltmeter (should be close to 14.0 volts), locate and correct cause of incorrect reading.

svcsubproc.title: Alternator With No Output

note.para: NOTE: Test hole is provided in SRE housing to allow direct grounding of rotor field circuit ( Figure 32). Grounding the brush tab inside this hole bypasses the regulator and turns the alternator on in FULL FIELD mode. If alternator output is observed with the brush tab grounded, the previous low output is due to conditions within the regulator. In the full field mode the voltage is not regulated and can exceed 16 volts.

svcsubproc.para:
If voltage is lower than reading previously recorded with engine stopped, there is no alternator output. Proceed to section on , REPAIR PROCEDURE
.

If voltage is higher than previous reading with engine stopped, alternator output is present. Proceed to section on RATED OUTPUT CHECK
.

If battery is overcharged (as evidenced by excessive water use or electrolyte spewing from battery vents), light bulbs or other electrical equipment have shortened life due to suspected high system voltage, or system voltmeter reads above normal range, run engine at moderate speed with all electrical loads off. Voltage reading at the Alternator or battery should be between 13.5 -14.5 volts and never higher than 15 volts.

If voltage is erratic or goes above 15 volts, replace regulator as described under REPAIR PROCEDURE
.
